headline.main: RAMIREZ VACATES PRESIDENTIAL VILLA; Reports in Uruguay Declare He Has Resigned Office in Favor of Farrell

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 -- The resignation of President Ramirez was delivered by his son-in-law, Maj. Francisco Filippi, to Acting President Farrell. At the same time General Ramirez sent a copy of his resignation to the President of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 -- The resignation of President Ramirez was delivered by his son-in-law, Maj. Francisco Filippi, to Acting President Farrell. At the same time General Ramirez sent a copy of his resignation to the President of the Supreme Court, together with a letter in which it is believed that he explained the reasons why he had taken that step.

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 11 -- The political overturn in Argentina and the action of Chile and Paraguay in recognizing the Buenos Aires Government regardless of the views of the United States and the position finally to be taken by the other American...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 11 -- The political overturn in Argentina and the action of Chile and Paraguay in recognizing the Buenos Aires Government regardless of the views of the United States and the position finally to be taken by the other American republics has posed the question of the success of the Roosevelt Administration in dealing with Latin America in its most acute form since the Good Neighbor policy was enunciated eleven years ago.
docs.abstract: challenge to US good-neighbor policy discussed

headline.main: GOOD NEIGHBOR POLICY PUT TO A SEVERE TEST; Program in Latin America Challenged By the Crisis Over Argentina

docs.snippet: The six counties of Northern Ireland, containing a population of 1,275,000, are at war as Britain's ally, the site of important naval and military installations. The twenty-six counties of Southern Ireland, containing a population of 2,900,000 and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The six counties of Northern Ireland, containing a population of 1,275,000, are at war as Britain's ally, the site of important naval and military installations. The twenty-six counties of Southern Ireland, containing a population of 2,900,000 and forming the nation of Eire, have remained neutral.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 11 -- Argentina's former President, Pedro Ramirez, asserts that he was obliged to abandon his office because he was the victim of intrigue and of a campaign of falsehoods that made his continuance as head of the State...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 11 -- Argentina's former President, Pedro Ramirez, asserts that he was obliged to abandon his office because he was the victim of intrigue and of a campaign of falsehoods that made his continuance as head of the State incompatible with his dignity and honor.
docs.abstract: Ramirez privately circulated lr of resignation charges plot to oust him; he states hostility to Farrell and his Mins, int; press warned against printing anything connected with resignation; Farrell formally installed by virtue of decree bearing own signature and those of Mins

headline.main: RAMIREZ CHARGES PLOT OUSTED HIM; Privately Circulated Text of Resignation Letter Avows Intrigue Led to His Fall

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 14 -- The Argentine GOU [Grupo de Oficiales Unidos or United Officers Group], mysterious organization that more than once blocked former President Pedro P. Ramirez's efforts to draw closer to the United Nations, was...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 14 -- The Argentine GOU [Grupo de Oficiales Unidos or United Officers Group], mysterious organization that more than once blocked former President Pedro P. Ramirez's efforts to draw closer to the United Nations, was dissolved by its governing board on Feb. 23, it was learned today.

headline.main: ARGENTINE CLIQUE QUITS FORMAL ROLE; Disbanding of GOU, Anti-U.S. Officer Group, Discounted -- New Crisis Is Nipped

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 15 -- The Argentine Government yesterday arrested Gen. Benjamin Menendez, a leader of army officers who believe that the military government has failed to achieve the purposes of the June 4 revolution and should resign to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 15 -- The Argentine Government yesterday arrested Gen. Benjamin Menendez, a leader of army officers who believe that the military government has failed to achieve the purposes of the June 4 revolution and should resign to make room for a government composed of civilians with only a few officers.
docs.abstract: Gen Menendez held for article in Buenos Aires Cabildo urging mil govt replacement by civilian rule; Sup Ct recognizes Farrell as Pres

headline.main: ARGENTINA SEIZES CRITICAL GENERAL; Menendez Is Held for Urging Military Government to Make Way for Civilian Rule

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 15 -- The Foreign Economic Administration notified American exporters today in Current Export Bulletin No. 152 that it is loosening some of the controls over the shipment of several groups of manufactured products to Latin-American...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 15 -- The Foreign Economic Administration notified American exporters today in Current Export Bulletin No. 152 that it is loosening some of the controls over the shipment of several groups of manufactured products to Latin-American republics "in attempts to bring exporter and importer in closer contact with each other."
